an10.169:4.1: Then Saṅgārava the brahmin went up to the Buddha,
an10.169:4.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
an10.169:5.1: “Master Gotama, what is the near shore? And what is the far shore?”
an10.169:5.2: “Killing living creatures is the near shore, brahmin, and not killing living creatures is the far shore.
an10.169:5.3: Stealing is the near shore, and not stealing is the far shore.
an10.169:5.4: Sexual misconduct is the near shore, and avoiding sexual misconduct is the far shore.
an10.169:5.5: Lying is the near shore, and not lying is the far shore.
an10.169:5.6: Divisive speech is the near shore, and avoiding divisive speech is the far shore.
an10.169:5.7: Harsh speech is the near shore, and avoiding harsh speech is the far shore.
an10.169:5.8: Meaningless speech is the near shore, and avoiding meaningless speech is the far shore.
an10.169:5.9: Covetousness is the near shore, and contentment is the far shore.
an10.169:5.10: Ill will is the near shore, and good will is the far shore.
an10.169:5.11: Wrong view is the near shore, and right view is the far shore.
an10.169:5.12: This is the near shore, and this is the far shore.”
an10.169:6.2: who cross to the far shore.
an10.169:7.1: When the teaching is well explained,
an10.169:7.3: are the ones who will cross over
an10.169:7.4: the realm of death so very hard to cross.
an10.169:8.2: an astute person should develop the bright.
an10.169:8.4: for the seclusion so hard to enjoy,
an10.169:9.1: you should try to find delight there,
an10.169:9.3: With no possessions, an astute person
an10.169:9.4: should cleanse themselves of mental corruptions.
an10.169:10.1: And those whose minds are rightly developed
an10.169:10.6: they are extinguished in this world.”
